Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the photo by stating that it reflects what animals feel during the Australian wildfires, when in fact the image was taken before the bushfires began and the koalas were not rescued from fires.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the photo depicts a mother and son koala rescued in the Australian bushfires.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo is related to the Australian bushfires without verifying its context or source.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo was taken in July 2019, well before the 2019-2020 Australian bushfire crisis began.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the photo was taken at the Australian Reptile Park and features koalas that are residents of the zoo, not animals rescued from bushfires.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting misleading information and misrepresenting the origin and context of the photo.
Understate: There is no evident understatement bias in the provided claim.
